a.span: LPS COVID19 and Remote Learning Resource Site

div.style: background-size: cover; background-position: center center; background-image: url(https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/kTnt2dwVK_EGdOHH_RDhPNtbomhxHM2ZIbWBx0323eaOK2G9zs811JIvUibewXNgUMhpPjqEPA=w16383);

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.h3: Joy in learning, curiosity in life, and compassion in all we do.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: LHS students from the Robotics Team; Anhad Sawhney, Santiago Parizek, Kyle McCandless, Joel McCandless, Jesse Gilbert, Mikhail Alperovich, and Samuel Pardoe, have been producing masks, face shields, and other protective equipment to assist healthcare workers!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: We are in the midst of the global COVID-19 pandemic, necessitating an emergency shift in our teaching and learning priorities. The Lexington Public Schools will be offering remote learning for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Below is information and resources that families may find helpful during this time.
If you have questions or concerns, we encourage you to review information provided on this webpage and reach out to LPS staff from your child’s school.
See updates and news from the Lexington Superintendent of Schools on Twitter at @lexingtonsuper.
